dashboard.title: NutriChecker
dashboard.personalizedRecommendationsDescription: Personalized recommendations can be requested once per day. This allows AI to analyze your data and provide quality advice based on weekly nutrition statistics.

motivationMessages.firstTime: Welcome! It's great that you've decided to start tracking your nutrition. Let's begin the journey to healthy habits! üéØ
success: Great job! Yesterday you stayed within your calorie goals perfectly. Keep it up! Let's continue moving toward our goal today üî•
Excellent! Yesterday went according to plan - calories under control. Let's repeat that success today! üí™
You nailed your nutrition yesterday! Plan executed perfectly. Let's do the same awesome work today ‚≠ê
Yesterday was amazing - calories on point! Great job maintaining discipline. Let's keep it up today! üöÄ
Superb! Yesterday you showed how to control calories properly. Excellent work. Let's continue in the same spirit! üéØ
Bravo! Yesterday's calorie result was exactly what the doctor ordered. Let's repeat that achievement today! ‚ú®
Well done! Yesterday you did everything smart - nutrition on track! Keep it up. Let's show the same class today üí•
Smart work! You handled calories brilliantly yesterday. You're clearly working on yourself. Let's continue today! üåü
Excellent work! Yesterday your calories were right on target! Respect for such discipline. Let's do the same today! üî•
Great job! Yesterday you showed iron discipline with calories. That's the path to success. Let's maintain the bar today! üí™
exceeded: Good job tracking! Yesterday's calories were a bit above plan, but that's normal. Let's get back on track today! üíô
Smart tracking! Yesterday was active calorie-wise - a bit above normal. Let's adjust course and move forward today! üí™
Great that you're keeping track! Yesterday was a high-calorie day, but not critical. Let's show how it's done today! üåü
Good job being honest! Yesterday went over the calorie limit, but these days happen. Let's bounce back today! üî•
Great that you don't give up! Yesterday calories exceeded the goal, but that's experience. Let's stick to the plan today! üéØ
Bravo for persistence! Yesterday was nutritionally rich. Let's get back in the groove today! ‚ú®
Good job not giving up! Yesterday had more calories than desired. Let's make corrections today! üí•
Smart approach! Yesterday was a high-calorie day - a bit of excess. Let's show the right approach today! üåü
Great persistence! Yesterday calories went into the plus, but that's not a problem. Let's work according to plan today! üî•
Good job with honest tracking! Yesterday was active food-wise - a bit above normal. Let's stay on course to the goal today! üí™
noData: Good job coming back! There was no data yesterday, but today is a great day to start tracking progress! üåü
Smart move! Yesterday passed without records, but today is the perfect time to get to work and move toward the goal! üí™
Great that you don't give up! Yesterday we missed nutrition tracking, but today we start with new energy! üöÄ
Good job returning! Yesterday no information came in, but today let's show how to track properly! ‚≠ê
Excellent that you're back with us! Yesterday stayed empty, but today let's fill the diary and go for success! üéØ

goalTracking.thankYouForWeeklyCheck: Thank you for the weekly check!

fallbackRecommendations.limitSweetDrinksAndFastFood: Limit sweet drinks and fast food
fallbackRecommendations.header: Personalized recommendations based on your check:
fallbackRecommendations.lowEnergy: Increase protein and complex carbohydrate intake to maintain energy
fallbackRecommendations.lowMotivation: Set small intermediate goals to maintain motivation
fallbackRecommendations.poorDiet: Try planning meals in advance and preparing healthy snacks
fallbackRecommendations.lowExercise: Start with 10-15 minutes of activity per day, gradually increasing time
fallbackRecommendations.poorSleep: Maintain a sleep schedule: go to bed and wake up at the same time
fallbackRecommendations.highStress: Practice relaxation techniques: meditation, deep breathing
fallbackRecommendations.keepGoing: Great work! Keep it up to achieve your goal

goalTracking.analyzingPersonalizedRecommendations: Analyzing your data for personalized recommendations
goalTracking.dailyOpportunityReminder: Remember: every day is a new opportunity to become better. You're on the right path!

lowEnergyTips.1: Increase protein intake at every meal

highEnergyTips.1: Great energy! Maintain your current routine

moderateEnergyTips.2: Drink more water throughout the day

mainGoals.emotionalEating: Main goal: Work on mindful eating. Try pausing before eating and asking yourself - am I really hungry?
mainGoals.timeShortage: Main goal: Plan your meals in advance. Prepare healthy snacks for the week ahead.
mainGoals.general: Main goal: Continue following your meal plan and tracking progress.

This action will permanently delete all app data: products, progress, settings, nutrition history and absolutely all information.

This action is irreversible!
settings.clearDataSuccessMessage: All data successfully deleted. You will be redirected to the initial setup.
settings.clearDataErrorMessage: An error occurred while clearing data. Please try again.

calculationScience.title: How Calculations Work
calculationScience.introText: NutriChecker uses proven scientific formulas and considers your individual characteristics to create a personalized nutrition plan.

basics.title: Basic Calculations
basics.subtitle: How we determine your calorie needs
basics.bmrExplanation: We start by calculating your Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) ‚Äî the minimum number of calories your body burns for vital functions at rest.
basics.formulaDescription: This formula is considered most accurate for most people with ¬±10% precision
basics.tdeeExplanation: Then we multiply BMR by your activity coefficient to get Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE):

personalization.title: Personalization
personalization.subtitle: 47 factors for accurate calculation
personalization.explanation: Your onboarding answers help us consider many factors affecting metabolism:
personalization.example: For example, if you indicated emotional eating under stress, we add buffer calories. If you have hypothyroidism, we reduce basal metabolism by 5-10%.

macros.title: Macronutrients
macros.subtitle: Proteins, fats, and carbohydrates
macros.qualityMatters: We don't just count calories ‚Äî their quality and ratio matter:
macros.proteinThermal: Proteins: 20-30% of calories spent on digestion
macros.proteinBenefit: High-protein diet naturally burns more calories!
macros.proteinNeeds: Protein needs are calculated by body weight:

safety.title: Safety
safety.subtitle: Protecting your health
safety.noDangerousDiets: We never recommend dangerous diets. Our algorithms include multiple checks:
safety.minimumThresholds: Minimum thresholds: no less than 1200 kcal for women, 1500 for men
safety.safePace: Safe pace: maximum 1 kg per week
safety.medicalLimitations: Medical limitations: consideration of special health conditions

adaptation.title: Adaptation
adaptation.subtitle: System learns and adjusts
adaptation.uniqueOrganism: Your body is unique, so we constantly adjust recommendations:
adaptation.plateau: ‚Ä¢ Progress plateau for more than 2 weeks

scientificBasis.title: Scientific Basis
scientificBasis.description: Our algorithms are based on World Health Organization recommendations, metabolism and nutrition research, Mifflin-St Jeor, Harris-Benedict, Katch-McArdle formulas.

disclaimer.title: Important Information
disclaimer.accuracy: All calculations are estimates based on scientific formulas and population data with ¬±10% accuracy. The app is for informational purposes only and does not replace medical consultation.
disclaimer.consultation: For medical conditions, pregnancy, breastfeeding, or specific athletic goals, please consult with a doctor or registered dietitian.

permissions.cameraUsage: This app uses the camera to scan product barcodes and get information about their calories, nutritional content, and allergens.
permissions.cameraAccess: Allow NutriChecker to access your camera to scan food products.
permissions.photoLibraryUsage: This app requires access to your photo library so you can select photos.
permissions.photoLibraryAccess: Allow NutriChecker to access your photo library to import images of food products.

photoAnalysis.title: Food Analysis
photoAnalysis.tip1: Take photos in good lighting, holding the camera from above
photoAnalysis.tip2: Capture the entire portion in the frame
photoAnalysis.tip3: For packaged products, photograph the ingredient label
photoAnalysis.tip4: Place a utensil nearby for accurate size determination
photoAnalysis.nonFoodError: Could not recognize food products in this photo. Please retake the photo.
photoAnalysis.analysisError: Unable to recognize food in the photo. Please take another photo with better lighting.
photoAnalysis.networkError: A network error occurred during analysis. Please check your internet connection and try again.
photoAnalysis.criticalError: Failed to recognize product in the image. Try taking a clearer photo of the food.
photoAnalysis.generalAnalysisError: Failed to analyze image. Please try again.

welcome.title: Welcome!
welcome.subtitle: Let's create a personalized plan that will help you achieve success.

gender.title: Select your gender
gender.subtitle: This is needed for more accurate calculation of your body's energy needs

birthday.title: When is your birthday?
birthday.subtitle: Your age helps accurately calculate daily calorie needs

heightWeight.heightSubtitle: Your height is used to determine optimal weight and calculate daily calorie needs.
heightWeight.weightSubtitle: Your current weight will help determine how many calories you need to reach your goal.

goalSetting.title: What is your main goal?
goalSetting.subtitle: Choose the primary goal you're striving for
goalSetting.targetWeightTitle: What weight do you want to achieve?
goalSetting.rateTitle: How fast do you want to achieve your goal?
goalSetting.rateSubtitle: Choose a comfortable weight loss speed for you
goalSetting.recommendedText: Recommended target weight for sustainable and healthy results:

loseWeight.label: Weight Loss
loseWeight.description: Lose weight and reach your desired weight

activityLevel.title: How active are you?
activityLevel.subtitle: Your physical activity level affects calorie needs

moderatelyActive.label: Moderately Active
moderatelyActive.description: Moderate intensity workouts 3-5 times per week

units.title: Choose measurement units
units.subtitle: Which measurement units are more convenient for you?

dietPreference.title: Your dietary preferences
dietPreference.subtitle: Choose a nutrition type that suits you

vegetarian.label: Vegetarian
vegetarian.description: Excludes meat but includes dairy and eggs

lowCarb.label: Low-Carb Diet
lowCarb.description: Reduced carbs, increased proteins and fats

mealFrequency.title: How often do you prefer to eat?
mealFrequency.subtitle: Choose the eating pattern that suits you best

fiveMeals.label: 5 meals
fiveMeals.description: Frequent small meals throughout the day

intermittent.label: Intermittent fasting
intermittent.description: Alternating periods of eating and fasting

confidenceLevel.title: How confident are you in achieving your goal?
confidenceLevel.subtitle: Rate your confidence in being able to achieve your set goal

challenges.title: What challenges do you face?
challenges.subtitle: Select obstacles that prevent you from reaching your goal

descriptions.emotionalEating: I often eat when experiencing stress or other strong emotions
descriptions.cravings: Hard to resist sweets or other unhealthy foods
descriptions.timeConstraints: I don't have enough time to prepare healthy food
descriptions.socialPressure: Hard to stick to diet during social events or celebrations
descriptions.lackOfMotivation: It's hard for me to maintain motivation long-term
descriptions.plateaus: Weight stops at the same level
descriptions.nightEating: I often eat late in the evening or at night
descriptions.stress: High stress levels interfere with maintaining a healthy lifestyle
descriptions.lackOfKnowledge: I don't always know which foods are truly beneficial

exerciseIntent.title: Let's talk about physical exercise
exerciseIntent.subtitle: Do you plan to engage in physical exercise while working on weight loss?

intermittentFasting.title: Intermittent Fasting
intermittentFasting.subtitle: Intermittent fasting is an eating pattern that alternates between periods of eating and fasting. This method can help with calorie control, but is not recommended for people with low appetite or medical contraindications.

caloriesCounting.title: Want to learn how calorie counting works?
caloriesCounting.subtitle: We can teach you the basics of calorie counting to help you better manage your nutrition.

tutorial.title: Calorie Counting Basics
tutorial.step1: A calorie is a unit of energy measurement. Food contains calories, and your body burns calories to provide energy.
tutorial.step2: To lose weight, you need to consume fewer calories than you burn - this creates a calorie deficit.
tutorial.step3: Main sources of calories in food: proteins (4 kcal/g), carbohydrates (4 kcal/g), fats (9 kcal/g), and alcohol (7 kcal/g).
tutorial.step4: Our calorie counter will help you track calorie intake and simplify the process of achieving your goals.
tutorial.tip: Tip: try not only to count calories but also pay attention to food quality. Nutritious foods will help you feel full longer.

calorieBudgetIntro.title: Next step - your calorie budget
calorieBudgetIntro.subtitle: Calorie budget is the most important element of your weight loss program.
calorieBudgetIntro.explanation: A calorie budget determines how many calories you can consume daily to achieve your weight loss goals. It's like a financial budget, but for your nutrition.
calorieBudgetIntro.deficitExplanation: Maintaining a calorie deficit ‚Äî when you consume fewer calories than you burn ‚Äî is the foundation of weight loss.
calorieBudgetIntro.personalCalculation: We will calculate your personal calorie budget based on your age, gender, height, weight, and activity level.

calorieBudgetInfo.title: Your calorie budget: {{calories}} kcal
calorieBudgetInfo.subtitle: Calorie budget is the most important element of your weight loss program. Here's how it's calculated:
calorieBudgetInfo.preliminaryNote: * Preliminary calculation based on basic data
calorieBudgetInfo.willBeRefinedNote: Precise values will be calculated after collecting additional information about your habits and preferences.
calorieBudgetInfo.bmrDescription: We use the Mifflin-St Jeor formula for accurate calculation of calories needed by your body at rest, based on your age, gender, height, and weight.
calorieBudgetInfo.activityDescription: Then we multiply BMR by an activity coefficient to get total daily energy expenditure (TDEE).
calorieBudgetInfo.deficitDescription: For healthy weight loss, we create a moderate deficit of 500 kcal per day, ensuring a loss of about 0.5 kg per week.
calorieBudgetInfo.limitMale: We never recommend calorie intake below 1500 kcal per day for men.
calorieBudgetInfo.limitFemale: We never recommend calorie intake below 1200 kcal per day for women.
calorieBudgetInfo.budgetNote: If you consume an average of {{calories}} calories per day, you will lose weight at a safe pace.
calorieBudgetInfo.adjustmentNote: Calorie budget may be adjusted as you progress. When weight and activity level change, calorie needs will change too.

nutritionFocus.title: Choose your nutrition strategy
nutritionFocus.subtitle: Choosing a nutrition strategy will help us create the most suitable recommendations and determine target nutrient values for you.

caloriesOnly.label: Calories Only
caloriesOnly.description: Track only total calories without considering nutrients

balanced.label: Balanced Nutrition (Recommended)
balanced.description: Optimal balance of proteins, fats, and carbs for overall health

highProtein.label: High-Protein Nutrition
highProtein.description: Focus on proteins to preserve muscle mass

lowCarb.label: Low-Carb Nutrition
lowCarb.description: Reduced carbs, increased proteins and fats

stressResponse.title: How do you usually respond to stress?
stressResponse.subtitle: Choose the most characteristic way you respond to stress
stressResponse.note: Understanding your stress response will help us develop strategies to prevent stress-related eating setbacks.

descriptions.emotionalEating: I turn to food when experiencing stress or negative emotions
descriptions.lossOfAppetite: I lose my appetite when stressed
descriptions.exercise: I engage in sports or physical activity to relieve stress
descriptions.sleep: I sleep more when experiencing stress
descriptions.socializing: I turn to friends or loved ones for support
descriptions.mindfulness: I practice meditation, yoga, or other mindfulness techniques
descriptions.avoidance: I try to avoid stressful situations
descriptions.creative: I engage in creative activities or hobbies to relieve stress

foodPreferences.title: What matters most to you in food?
foodPreferences.subtitle: Your nutrition priorities will help us offer the most suitable diet recommendations.

taste.label: Taste
taste.description: It's important to me that food is delicious and brings pleasure

health.label: Health benefits
health.description: It's important to me that my food is nutritious and healthy

convenience.label: Cooking convenience
convenience.description: It's important to me that food is simple to prepare and doesn't take much time

price.label: Affordable price
price.description: It's important to me that healthy eating is economically accessible

tradition.label: Familiar food
tradition.description: It's important to me that nutrition supports my training or health goals

foodVariety.title: How often do you try new foods or recipes?
foodVariety.subtitle: Your openness to new foods and dishes will help us determine how diverse your nutrition plan should be.

descriptions.often: I regularly try new products and recipes, I enjoy experimenting
descriptions.sometimes: From time to time I try new recipes or products, but mostly stick to familiar dishes
descriptions.rarely: I prefer to eat proven dishes and rarely try something new
descriptions.never: I regularly eat the same foods and dishes, don't strive for variety

mealFeelings.title: How do you usually feel after eating?
mealFeelings.subtitle: Your well-being after meals will help understand which eating pattern suits you best.
mealFeelings.disclaimer: Note: If you regularly experience serious discomfort after eating, we recommend consulting with a doctor.

descriptions.energized: After eating, I feel a surge of energy, comfort and satisfaction.
descriptions.satisfied: I usually feel comfortable, but sometimes I eat too much and feel heavy.
descriptions.tired: After eating, I often feel sleepy, tired or have decreased energy.
descriptions.bloated: After eating, I often experience bloating, discomfort or other unpleasant sensations.
descriptions.stillHungry: A short time after eating, I start feeling hungry again.

difficultSituations.title: How do you handle difficult situations?
difficultSituations.subtitle: Difficult situations may arise on the path to your goal. Your ability to handle them affects long-term success.

handleWell.label: I handle them well, using effective strategies
handleWell.description: I have proven methods for dealing with difficult situations, and they usually work.

copeMost.label: I cope in most cases
copeMost.description: I usually find ways to solve problems, although sometimes it requires effort.

struggleStuck.label: I struggle and often feel stuck
struggleStuck.description: I have difficulty finding effective solutions and often feel helpless.

hardManage.label: I have trouble managing difficult situations
hardManage.description: Difficult situations cause me severe stress, and I have trouble finding a way out.

medication.title: Do you take any weight loss medications or supplements?
medication.subtitle: This information will help us adapt recommendations considering the effects of medications on your metabolism and appetite.
medication.disclaimer: Important: This information is used only for personalizing recommendations. We do not provide medical advice or prescriptions. Always consult with a doctor before starting or changing any medications or supplements.

descriptions.notUsing: I choose weight loss only through changing diet and physical activity
descriptions.prescription: For example, GLP-1 agonists (Ozempic, Wegovy, Saxenda) or other doctor-approved appetite suppression medications
descriptions.overTheCounter: For example, Orlistat (Alli, Xenical) - the only approved drug in this category
descriptions.supplements: Vitamins, minerals or supplements. Important: most "fat burners" lack scientific evidence of effectiveness
descriptions.herbal: You're not taking anything now, but considering medication support in the future

eatingHabitsAssessment.title: How do you rate your current eating habits?
eatingHabitsAssessment.subtitle: An honest assessment will help us better understand what type of recommendations will be most useful for you.
eatingHabitsAssessment.tip: Eating habits are formed over time and can be changed through a gradual, consistent approach. Our program adapts to your current level and will help develop healthier relationships with food.

descriptions.excellent: I know what food suits my body and usually make healthy choices
descriptions.good: I have decent habits, but I want to improve them to achieve my goals
descriptions.improving: I try different approaches to find what works for me
descriptions.needWork: I feel uncertain and need clear recommendations
descriptions.poor: I need serious help changing my eating habits
descriptions.figuring-out: I'm still figuring out what works best for me

weightManagementObstacle.title: What is your main obstacle in weight management?
weightManagementObstacle.subtitle: Understanding your challenges will help us develop a plan that addresses your specific problems.
weightManagementObstacle.helpNote: Identifying main obstacles is the first step to overcoming them. We'll help you build strategies to combat your selected challenges.

descriptions.emotionalEating: Using food to cope with stress or emotions
descriptions.timeConstraints: Hard to find time for meal planning or preparing healthy food
descriptions.socialSituations: Difficulties maintaining diet in social situations
descriptions.lackOfMotivation: Hard to stay motivated on the path to long-term goals
descriptions.plateaus: Weight stops at the same level and doesn't decrease
descriptions.cravings: Strong desire to eat sweets, fatty or unhealthy food
descriptions.selfControl: Hard to say "no" to favorite foods or avoid overeating
descriptions.other: I have other difficulties not listed above

calorieBudgetConfirm.title: Your budget - {{calories}} calories
calorieBudgetConfirm.subtitle: If you consistently consume an average of {{calories}} calories, you will lose weight at your chosen pace.
calorieBudgetConfirm.refinementNote: Precise values will be calculated after collecting all data about your habits

tips.tip1: Try to track calorie intake as accurately as possible
tips.tip2: Don't forget to account for drinks and snacks
tips.tip3: Include protein and fiber-rich foods in your diet for lasting satiety
tips.tip4: Regularly check your progress and adjust your calorie budget if needed

calorieBudgetConfirm.note: If you feel the budget is too low or high, you can always adjust it in the app settings.

calorieSchedule.title: Does a calorie schedule work for you?
calorieSchedule.subtitle: A calorie schedule allows you to distribute calories differently depending on the day of the week. For example, you can consume more calories on workout days and fewer on rest days. A fixed budget is recommended for beginners.

descriptions.fixed: Same amount of calories every day - this is simpler and more convenient for most users
descriptions.flexible: Different amounts of calories on different days of the week - suitable for experienced users or those with regularly changing activity levels

planReady.title: Your plan is ready!
planReady.subtitle: We've created a personalized nutrition plan and recommendations that will help you achieve your goals.
planReady.successMessage: Your individual plan includes everything necessary for successful achievement of your goals.
planReady.readyToStart: Ready to start your journey to a healthy lifestyle? Let's unlock your potential!

features.personalizedCaloriesDesc: Calculated specifically for your goals and lifestyle
features.nutritionBalanceDesc: Optimal ratio of proteins, fats, and carbohydrates
features.mealPlanningDesc: Recommendations for timing and frequency of meals

goalSetConfirm.title: You've set your goal!
goalSetConfirm.subtitle: Now it's time to create a plan that will help you achieve it.
goalSetConfirm.planMessage: Your personalized plan will be created considering this goal and other selected parameters.

goals.feelConfident: Feel more confident in your body

summary.title: Your Personal Plan
summary.subtitle: Let's summarize and get ready to start your journey to your goal

setbacksResponses.hardBack: Hard to get back on track
setbacksResponses.hard-back: Hard to get back on track

adaptability.title: How do you cope with unexpected changes?
adaptability.subtitle: Your ability to adapt to changes can significantly impact your success in achieving weight loss goals.

embraceQuickly.label: I quickly embrace changes
embraceQuickly.description: I easily adapt to new situations and quickly make necessary adjustments.

adaptTime.label: I adapt, but need time
adaptTime.description: I need some time to get used to changes, but eventually I manage to cope.

struggleTry.label: I struggle but try my best
struggleTry.description: It's difficult for me to adapt to changes, but I do everything possible to adjust.

findOverwhelming.label: Changes cause me stress
findOverwhelming.description: It's very hard for me to accept changes, and I often feel anxious or stressed.

planPreview.title: Your personal plan is ready! üéâ
planPreview.subtitle: See what we've prepared specifically for you

intermittentFastingSkipConfirm.title: We'll continue without intermittent fasting
intermittentFastingSkipConfirm.subtitle: This is a good choice! Intermittent fasting is not necessary to achieve your weight loss goals.

benefits.flexibility: More flexibility in distributing meals throughout the day
benefits.eatWhenHungry: Ability to eat when you're actually hungry
benefits.naturalApproach: A more natural approach to eating for many people
benefits.lessRisk: Lower risk of potential side effects such as headaches or irritability

intermittentFastingSkipConfirm.futureNote: If you want to try intermittent fasting in the future, you can always change this setting in the app settings.

goalDateIntro.title: We're almost ready to show your goal achievement date
goalDateIntro.subtitle: Before we do that, let's learn a bit more about your strengths and challenges you might face.
goalDateIntro.whyNeeded: Why do we need this information?

reasons.psychologicalProfile: Understanding your psychological profile will allow us to adapt recommendations and advice specifically for you.
reasons.anticipateChallenges: We'll be able to anticipate potential difficulties and provide you with tools to overcome them in advance.
reasons.useStrengths: By using your strengths, we can accelerate your progress and increase the likelihood of achieving your goal.

goalDateIntro.questionsPreview: On the following screens we'll ask you about

questions.adaptability: How you cope with unexpected changes
questions.challenges: How you perceive difficulties and challenges
questions.setbacks: How you react to failures and obstacles
questions.confidence: How confident you are in your decisions

goalDateIntro.honestyNote: We value your honesty. Remember: there are no 'right' or 'wrong' answers here. Honest answers will help us create the best plan for you.

fixedCalorieBudgetConfirm.title: Great, we'll stick to {{calories}} calories every day
fixedCalorieBudgetConfirm.subtitle: If you change your mind, you can always add a flexible calorie schedule later.
fixedCalorieBudgetConfirm.explanation: A fixed daily calorie budget helps you stick to the same meal plan every day, making tracking and planning easier.
fixedCalorieBudgetConfirm.tip1: Try to distribute calories evenly throughout the day to avoid overeating.
fixedCalorieBudgetConfirm.tip2: Plan meals ahead to stay within your calorie budget.
fixedCalorieBudgetConfirm.tip3: Don't forget to account for liquid calories from drinks and sauces.

exerciseBenefits.subtitlePositive: Physical activity is an important element of a healthy lifestyle and weight loss
exerciseBenefits.subtitleNeutral: Even if you don't plan to exercise actively, here are some facts about physical activity

calories.title: Increases calorie burn
calories.description: Physical activity helps burn more calories even at rest

muscle.title: Preserves muscle mass
muscle.description: Strength training helps preserve muscles during weight loss

heart.title: Improves heart health
heart.description: Regular physical exercise strengthens the cardiovascular system

mood.title: Improves mood
mood.description: Exercise stimulates endorphin production and improves psychological well-being

exerciseBenefits.recommendationPositive: Before starting a new exercise program, it's recommended to consult with a doctor, especially if you have chronic conditions.
exerciseBenefits.recommendationNeutral: Even light physical activity, such as daily walks, can benefit your health.
exerciseBenefits.note: Remember that the foundation of weight loss is proper nutrition and calorie control, while physical activity is an additional tool.

weightLossPlan.title: Select a weight loss plan
weightLossPlan.subtitle: The plan determines the rate of weight loss and daily calorie budget. Choose the most suitable option for you.
weightLossPlan.refinementNote: Precise calories will be calculated considering all your data

steady.label: Gradual loss
steady.description: Comfortable and sustainable weight loss pace recommended by experts.

moderate.label: Moderate loss
moderate.description: Average weight loss pace, requires more discipline in nutrition.

aggressive.label: Intensive loss
aggressive.descriptionAvailable: Fast weight loss pace, recommended only with high TDEE.
aggressive.descriptionUnavailable: This plan is not available at your activity level. We recommend gradual loss.

weightLossPlan.disclaimer: Note: Weight loss rate may vary depending on individual body characteristics. Consultation with a doctor is recommended before starting any weight loss program.

planSummary.title: Your personalized plan is ready!
planSummary.subtitle: Based on your answers, we've created a personal weight loss plan that takes into account your preferences and goals.
planSummary.motivationText: Remember: success is the result of consistent small efforts that accumulate day by day!

steps.step1: Start tracking calorie and nutrient intake using our app
steps.step2: Regularly record your weight to track progress
steps.step3: Use our recipes and nutrition recommendations that match your plan
steps.step4: Adjust the plan in profile settings if needed

decisionMaking.title: How confident are you in your decisions?
decisionMaking.subtitle: Your confidence in making decisions about nutrition and health plays an important role in achieving your goals.

fullyTrust.label: Fully trust my choices
fullyTrust.description: I am confident in the correctness of my decisions and rarely doubt them.

confidentDoubt.label: Confident but sometimes doubt
confidentDoubt.description: In most cases I trust my decisions, but sometimes I have doubts.

oftenUnsure.label: Often feel uncertain
oftenUnsure.description: I regularly doubt the correctness of my decisions and feel anxious.

secondGuess.label: Constantly change my mind
secondGuess.description: I tend to frequently reevaluate and change my decisions and strongly doubt myself.

challengesView.title: How do you view challenges?
challengesView.subtitle: Your perception of difficulties and challenges helps us better understand how to support you on your path to achieving goals.

growthOpportunity.label: I see them as growth opportunities
growthOpportunity.description: I perceive difficulties as a chance to become better and develop.

tryLearn.label: I try to learn lessons, but sometimes get upset
tryLearn.description: I try to learn from difficulties, although sometimes they discourage me.

avoidFailure.label: I avoid them due to fear of failure
avoidFailure.description: I try not to face difficulties because I'm afraid I won't cope.

tooDifficult.label: I think they're too difficult to overcome
tooDifficult.description: It seems to me that difficulties often exceed my capabilities.

temptationResponse.title: How do you usually respond to temptations?
temptationResponse.subtitle: When you are tempted by food that's not part of your nutrition plan, how do you usually react?

easilyResist.label: I easily resist
easilyResist.description: I rarely give in to temptations and can easily maintain self-control.

usuallyControl.label: I usually control myself, but sometimes slip up
usuallyControl.description: In most cases I can resist, but sometimes I break my plan.

tryResist.label: I try to resist, but it's difficult
tryResist.description: It's hard for me to resist temptations, even when I try.

oftenGiveIn.label: I often give in to temptations
oftenGiveIn.description: It's very difficult for me to resist temptations, and I often deviate from my plan.

setbacksResponse.title: How do you usually respond to setbacks?
setbacksResponse.subtitle: When you face setbacks in achieving your goals, how do you usually react?

bounceBack.label: I quickly bounce back
bounceBack.description: I quickly get back on track, not letting setbacks throw me off course.

recoverEffort.label: I recover, but with effort
recoverEffort.description: It takes me some time and effort to get back to my plan after a setback.

hardBack.label: It's hard to get back on track
hardBack.description: After a setback, it's difficult for me to return to my plan, and recovery takes a long time.

struggleRecover.label: I struggle to recover
struggleRecover.description: I often can't fully get back to my plan after a serious setback.

nutritionIntro.title: Next step - nutrition
nutritionIntro.subtitle: Now let's talk about your nutrition strategy and food preferences.

infoItems.energy: Proper nutrition provides you with the energy and nutrients necessary for health and activity.
infoItems.quality: Food quality is as important as calorie quantity. A nutritious, balanced diet can enhance satiety on fewer calories.
infoItems.wellbeing: A properly chosen nutrition strategy can improve your well-being, energy, and even sleep quality.

nutritionIntro.nextSteps: In the following steps, we'll determine your nutrition preferences and find the optimal strategy that matches your needs and lifestyle.

medicalDisclaimer.title: This is not medical advice
medicalDisclaimer.subtitle: Discuss with your doctor the ideal nutrition and physical activity plan for your specific situation.
medicalDisclaimer.disclaimerText1: The recommendations in this app are based on general principles of healthy eating and weight loss. They do not replace professional medical consultation.
medicalDisclaimer.disclaimerText2: Before starting any weight loss program or changing your diet, we recommend consulting with a qualified medical professional, especially if you have any chronic conditions, allergies, or special nutritional needs.
medicalDisclaimer.consultTitle: It's important to consult with a doctor if you:

conditions.chronic: Have chronic conditions (diabetes, cardiovascular disease, high blood pressure)
conditions.medications: Take any medications that may affect weight or require a special diet
conditions.pregnancy: Are pregnant, breastfeeding, or planning pregnancy
conditions.eatingDisorders: Have a history of eating disorders or psychological problems related to food
conditions.weightIssues: Have significant excess or insufficient weight

medicalDisclaimer.acknowledgement: By continuing to use this app, you acknowledge that you understand our recommendations do not replace medical consultation, and you take responsibility for your health decisions.

summaryPlan.title: Your plan is ready!
summaryPlan.subtitle: We've created a personalized nutrition and workout plan based on your data and preferences.
summaryPlan.planError: Failed to create plan. Please try again.
summaryPlan.nextStepsDescription: Complete the app setup and start using NutriChecker to track your nutrition and progress. You can find your plan in the "Profile" section at any time.

planContent.title: PERSONALIZED NUTRITION AND WORKOUT PLAN
planContent.name: Name
planContent.willBeCalculated: Will be calculated in the app
planContent.proteinBenefit: provide satiety and preserve muscle mass
planContent.vegetarianProteinSources:
Recommended protein sources for vegetarians:
- Tofu and tempeh
- Legumes (lentils, chickpeas, beans)
- Quinoa
- Nuts and seeds
- Dairy products (if included in diet)
planContent.standardProteinSources:
Recommended protein sources:
- Chicken breast
- Turkey
- Fish
- Eggs
- Cottage cheese
- Greek yogurt
planContent.activeWorkoutPlan:
Based on your activity level and goals, recommended:
- Cardio: 3-4 times per week for 30-45 minutes
- Strength training: 2-3 times per week
- Stretching: every day for 10-15 minutes

Start with moderate loads and gradually increase intensity.
planContent.lightActivityPlan:
Even without intensive workouts, for health maintenance recommended:
- Daily walking: at least 7000-10000 steps
- Light stretching: 10-15 minutes per day
- Gradual increase in daily physical activity
planContent.lowConfidenceAdvice:
To increase confidence in achieving your goal, recommended:
- Set small, achievable goals
- Celebrate even small successes
- Keep a food and activity diary
- Find like-minded people or seek professional support
planContent.motivationAdvice:
To maintain motivation, recommended:
- Set specific weekly/monthly goals
- Track progress in the app
- Use non-material rewards for achievements
- Remember the benefits of a healthy lifestyle
planContent.personalizedStrategies: Most effective strategies for your psychological profile
planContent.emotionalEatingStrategies:
- Learn mindful eating techniques
- Find alternative ways to cope with stress
- Plan meals in advance to avoid impulsive decisions
planContent.generalStressStrategies:
- Maintain regular eating schedule
- Find healthy ways to relax
- Use deep breathing techniques during stress
planContent.step1: Use NutriChecker app to scan products and track calories
planContent.step2: Track your progress in the "Reports" section
planContent.step4: Regularly update your weight in the app for plan adjustments
planContent.planAdjustment: Your plan will automatically adjust based on your data and progress.

paywall.title: Premium Plan
paywall.mainSubtitle: Unlock all features to achieve your goals
paywall.termsText: By subscribing, you agree to the terms of use and privacy policy

setbacksResponse.hardBack: Hard to get back on track
setbacksResponse.hard-back: Hard to get back on track

planSettings.title: Configure Plan
planSettings.recommendation: Recommended: 0.3-0.7 kg per week for weight loss, 0.2-0.5 kg for weight gain

alerts.invalidStartWeight: Enter a valid starting weight (30-300 kg)
alerts.invalidTargetWeight: Enter a valid target weight (30-300 kg)
alerts.invalidWeeklyTarget: Enter a valid rate (0.1-2.0 kg per week)
alerts.weightDifferenceTooSmall: The difference between starting and target weight must be greater than 0.5 kg
alerts.saveError: Failed to save settings. Please try again.
alerts.resetMessage: This action will delete all progress data and weekly checks. It cannot be undone.
alerts.resetFeatureMessage: Will be implemented in the next update

goalsInfo.title: Your Personal Goals:
goalsInfo.description: Based on: your age, weight, height, activity, goal and nutrition preferences

productManagement.confirmDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete "{productName}" from history?
